meanings.definition: A device used to measure the yaw angle of an aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The pilot checked the yawmeter to ensure the plane was flying straight.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic calibrated the yawmeter before the flight.
meanings.sent3: The yawmeter beeped loudly, surprising everyone in the cockpit.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a yawmeter, always keeping track of the slightest movement.
meanings.sent5: The yawmeter's needle danced back and forth, showing the plane's direction.

meanings.definition: A tool that detects and measures the side-to-side movement of a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The truck driver relied on the yawmeter to keep the vehicle steady on the road.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic installed a new yawmeter to monitor the car's swaying.
meanings.sent3: The yawmeter beeped when the car made a sharp turn, surprising the passengers.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition acted like a yawmeter, sensing any deviation from the usual.
meanings.sent5: The yawmeter's reading showed the bus's gentle sway as it turned the corner.

meanings.definition: An instrument that determines the deviation of a ship from its intended course.
meanings.sent1: The captain adjusted the ship's course based on the yawmeter's readings.
meanings.sent2: The crew relied on the yawmeter to keep the ship on track during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The yawmeter's alarm went off when the ship veered off course, startling the sailors.
meanings.sent4: His instincts were a yawmeter, always guiding him back to his true path.
meanings.sent5: The yawmeter's display showed the ship's gradual drift away from the destination.
